solution_line_template: Noah earned ${price_large}/large painting x {num_large_last_month} large paintings = $<<{price_large}*{num_large_last_month}={large_sales_last_month}>>{large_sales_last_month} for the large paintings.

He also earned ${price_small}/small painting x {num_small_last_month} small paintings = $<<{price_small}*{num_small_last_month}={small_sales_last_month}>>{small_sales_last_month} for the small paintings.
His total sales last month were ${large_sales_last_month} + ${small_sales_last_month} = $<<{large_sales_last_month}+{small_sales_last_month}={total_sales_last_month}>>{total_sales_last_month}.
So, his sales this month are ${total_sales_last_month} x {sales_multiplier} = $<<{total_sales_last_month}*{sales_multiplier}={total_sales_this_month}>>{total_sales_this_month}.
